title: Strășeni District
text:
Strășeni () is an administrative district () in the central part of <a href="Moldova">Moldova</a>. Its administrative center and leading city is <a href="Str%C4%83%C8%99eni">Strășeni</a>. As of 1 January 2011, its population was 91,100.
The other principal town is <a href="Bucov%C4%83%C8%9B">Bucovăț</a>, to the north of the <a href="Chi%C8%99in%C4%83u">Moldovan capital</a>. Otherwise the district is divided between rural communities.
History.
The present territory of the district is inhabited since the <a href="Stone%20Age">Stone Age</a>, 30–20.000 BC. Localities with the oldest historical attestation are <a href="C%C4%83priana">Căpriana</a>, <a href="Dolna%2C%20Str%C4%83%C5%9Feni">Dolna</a>, <a href="Lozova">Lozova</a> and <a href="Vorniceni%2C%20Str%C4%83%C5%9Feni">Vorniceni</a>, they are first attested in 1420. <a href="C%C4%83priana%20monastery">Căpriana monastery</a> in 1429 received the status of the <a href="monastery">monastery</a>. The present territory of the district Strășeni, was part of the medieval lands <a href="L%C4%83pu%C8%99na%20County%20%28Romania%29">Lăpușna</a> and <a href="Orhei%20County%20%28Romania%29">Orhei</a> boundary of which is on the <a href="B%C3%AEc%20River">Bîc River</a>. In 1545 is remembered by scribes, <a href="Str%C4%83%C8%99eni">Strășeni</a> district center. In the 16th-18th centuries, the district develop both <a href="economic">economic</a> (<a href="trade">trade</a>, <a href="agriculture">agriculture</a>, <a href="forestry">forestry</a>) and <a href="cultural">cultural</a> (built <a href="monasteries">monasteries</a> and <a href="church%20%28building%29">churches</a>), as there has been a major increase of <a href="population">population</a>. In 1812, after the <a href="Russo-Turkish%20War%20%281806-1812%29">Russo-Turkish War (1806-1812)</a>, is the occupation of <a href="Basarabia">Basarabia</a>, Russian Empire during this period (1812-1917), there is an intense <a href="russification">russification</a> of the native population. In 1918 after the <a href="Russian%20Revolution%20%281917%29">collapse of the Russian Empire</a>, <a href="Union%20of%20Bessarabia%20with%20Romania">Bessarabia united with Romania</a> in this period (1918-1940, 1941-1944), the district is part of the <a href="Chi%C8%99in%C4%83u%20County">Chișinău County</a>. In 1940 after <a href="Molotov-Ribbentrop%20Treaty">Molotov-Ribbentrop Treaty</a>, <a href="Basarabia">Basarabia</a> is occupied by the <a href="USSR">USSR</a>. In 1991 as a result of the proclamation of <a href="Independence%20of%20Moldova">Independence of Moldova</a>, part and residence of the Chișinău County (1991-2003), and in 2003 became administrative unit of <a href="Moldova">Moldova</a>.
Geography.
Strășeni district is located in the central part of <a href="Republic%20of%20Moldova">Republic of Moldova</a>. The neighboring <a href="district">district</a>'s are <a href="C%C4%83l%C4%83ra%C8%99i%20District">Călărași District</a> in north-west, <a href="Orhei%20District">Orhei District</a> in north-east, <a href="Criuleni%20District">Criuleni District</a> in east, <a href="Chi%C8%99in%C4%83u">municipality of Chișinău</a>, <a href="Ialoveni%20District">Ialoveni District</a> and <a href="H%C3%AEnce%C8%99ti%20District">Hîncești District</a> in south and <a href="Nisporeni%20District">Nisporeni</a> in west. District is located on the <a href="Central%20Moldavian%20Plateau">Central Moldavian Plateau</a>, and <a href="Codri">Codri</a> forest region. <a href="Relief">Relief</a> hilly <a href="terrain">terrain</a> sloping from northwest to southeast, cut by <a href="valleys">valleys</a> and <a href="river">river</a>s. <a href="Erosion">Erosion</a> processes with a high intensity. The soil is mainly <a href="brown%20soil">brown soil</a> forest and <a href="gray">gray</a> soil.
Fauna.
<a href="Fauna">Fauna</a> typical <a href="central%20Europe">central Europe</a>, with the presence of such <a href="mammals">mammals</a> such as <a href="fox">fox</a>, <a href="wild%20boar">wild boar</a>, <a href="deer">deer</a>, <a href="hedgehog">hedgehog</a>s, <a href="wild%20cat">wild cat</a>, <a href="red%20deer">red deer</a>, <a href="wolf">wolf</a>, <a href="raccoon%20dog">raccoon dog</a>, <a href="wild%20cat">wild cat</a>, <a href="ferret">ferret</a> and others. Of <a href="birds">birds</a>: <a href="hawk">hawk</a>, <a href="crow">crow</a>, <a href="stork">stork</a>, <a href="eagle">eagle</a>s, <a href="egrets">egrets</a> and more. In the past forests were populated district of: <a href="brown%20bear">brown bear</a>, <a href="elk">elk</a>, <a href="bull">bull</a>, <a href="wisent">wisent</a>, disappeared due to excessive <a href="hunting">hunting</a>, but the <a href="deforestation">deforestation</a>.
Flora.
<a href="Forests">Forests</a> occupy 36.6% of the district are characterized by the presence of <a href="oak">oak</a>, <a href="english%20oak">english oak</a>, <a href="beech">beech</a>, <a href="hornbeam">hornbeam</a>, <a href="maple">maple</a>, <a href="Ash%20%28Fraxinus%29">ash</a>, <a href="lime%20%28fruit%29">lime</a> and other <a href="trees">trees</a>. From <a href="plants">plants</a>: <a href="clover">clover</a>, <a href="Campanula">bell</a>, <a href="Urtica">nettle</a> and others.
Rivers.
District is located in the <a href="Nistru%20river">Nistru river</a> basin. The main <a href="tributaries">tributaries</a> that cross the district are: Ichel (102 km, 63 miles) and <a href="B%C3%AEc%20River">Bic</a> (152 km, 94 miles). Most <a href="lake">lake</a>s have a <a href="natural">natural</a> origin. The largest is <a href="Ghidighici%20Reservoir">Ghidighici Reservoir</a>.
Demographics.
1 January 2012 the district population was 91,500 of which 23.7% <a href="Urban%20area">urban</a> and 76.3% <a href="rural">rural</a> population
Ethnic groups.
"Footnote": * There is an <a href="Controversy%20over%20ethnic%20and%20linguistic%20identity%20in%20Moldova">ongoing controversy</a> regarding the ethnic identification of Moldovans and Romanians.
Economy.
Main branches of the <a href="economy">economy</a> are <a href="agriculture">agriculture</a> and <a href="manufacturing">manufacturing</a> in district. <a href="Soil">Soil</a> and <a href="Climate">climatic</a> conditions favor the growth of <a href="cereals">cereals</a>, <a href="sunflower">sunflower</a>, <a href="grapes">grapes</a>, <a href="vegetables">vegetables</a>, <a href="fruit">fruit</a> and other crops. Of mineral resources in the district is <a href="stone">stone</a>, <a href="gravel">gravel</a>, <a href="pebble">pebble</a>s and sand of building in <a href="Micauti">Micauti</a> career. <a href="Communication">Communication</a> services are provided in Strășeni two companies "<a href="Moldtelecom">Moldtelecom</a>" and "<a href="Post%20of%20Moldova">Post of Moldova</a>".
The territory they are operating 15 factories processing of <a href="grapes">grapes</a>, a poultry factory in <a href="Bucov%C4%83%C5%A3">Bucovăţ</a>. Industry district is represented by 17 <a href="companies">companies</a>. The largest factory: SA "Marsrut", JSC "Caan" experimental-mechanical plant (included in the national <a href="privatization">privatization</a> program.
<a href="Arable%20land">Arable land</a> occupies 18 903 ha (25.9%) of the total <a href="agricultural">agricultural</a> land, <a href="vineyards">vineyards</a> occupy 8292 ha (11.3%), plantations of <a href="orchards">orchards</a> 3.386 ha (4.6%), 3244 ha <a href="grassland">grassland</a> (4.4%), 242 ha plantation of <a href="fruit">fruit</a> trees (0.3%), some 451 ha (0.6%).
Education.
In district active: 42 <a href="educational">educational</a> institutions, including: Total number of <a href="students">students</a>: 10,721. Currently the educational institutions of district <a href="teacher">teacher</a>'s operate in 1040.
Politics.
Strășeni district, both <a href="political">political</a> and <a href="electoral">electoral</a> support of <a href="Centre-right">right-wing parties</a> in <a href="Moldova">Moldova</a> represented by the <a href="Alliance%20for%20European%20Integration">AEI</a>. <a href="Party%20of%20Communists%20of%20the%20Republic%20of%20Moldova">PCRM</a> is in a continuous fall in the last three <a href="elections">elections</a>.
During the last three elections <a href="Alliance%20for%20European%20Integration">AEI</a> had an increase of 73.0%
Elections.
!style="background-color:#E9E9E9" align=center colspan="2" valign=center|Parties and coalitions
!style="background-color:#E9E9E9" align=right|Votes
!style="background-color:#E9E9E9" align=right|%
!style="background-color:#E9E9E9" align=right|+/−
Culture.
In Strășeni: 72 <a href="cultural">cultural</a> institutions, a culture <a href="house">house</a>, 32 <a href="community%20centers">community centers</a>, <a href="Club%20%28organization%29">clubs</a>, 35 <a href="libraries">libraries</a>, two <a href="art%20schools">art schools</a>, three <a href="museums">museums</a> and a famous <a href="monastic">monastic</a> complex.
Health.
In Strășeni district: a <a href="hospital">hospital</a> with general fund of 192 beds, a center of <a href="family%20physician">family physician</a>s in the composition of which are 15 offices of family <a href="Physician">doctor</a>s, 13 health centers, 9 offices of <a href="health">health</a>, the health district population. District operates: 134 doctors, 297 personal care environment, <a href="medical">medical</a> and auxiliary <a href="personnel">personnel</a> 306.
Transportation.
All <a href="Human%20settlement">localities</a> have regular <a href="Trade%20route">routes</a> to <a href="regional">regional</a> centers and <a href="capital%20city">capital</a>. The district is crossed by <a href="railways">railways</a>, means of <a href="communication">communication</a> used extensively to <a href="transport">transport</a> goods by <a href="business">business</a> district, and especially the town Strășeni. District is crossed by the <a href="M1%20road%20%28Moldova%29">M1 road</a> highway (Chisinau-Ungheni).
